titleStmt.title: John P. Harrison to James F. Robinson
CWG8971

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Covington KyAugust 13, '63
To His Excellency: Jas F Robinson
Governor of -- Kentucky

Accompanying you will find the Petition of to have a fine adjudged against him by Wm Shmoddle J. P. B Eggleston of $50. cancelled or pardoned. I send the statements of Esqr (at the close of the Petition) who acted as County Attorney, also of the acting Magistrate and of the , all Joining in the prayer for his pardon. I do not know that you will require anything further and request that you will send your answer to my address or to B Eggelston Esqr J. P. K. C. of this City. With sentiments of great esteem, belive meK CJ F FiskMayor of the City

Yours Respetfully
John P. Harrison
Post office Box 303

Hon. Jas F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky
